page.title: 15Housing in Penarth.
page.content: The style of housing in our "D" block ranges from large individually styled Victorian homes, to the areas of pre- war terraced and post war private and council houses. There is also a variety in the materials used ranging from local limestone bricks, through to slate and tiled roofing. With the creation of the docks and the coming of the railways in the late 19th century,the town spread westward. Wealth ship owners created the large houses in Westbourne, Plymouth, Victoria and Stanwell Roads. Even as recently as 1968 there was a farm at the lower end of Corneswell Road, now a heavily built up area, showing spreading urban life. There are three main areas of modern development Llandough, Murch and Cow- slip Estates. All a mixture of brick terraced semis and detatched styles.
